Articles.Content:
I just downloaded this space flight app for my phone - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=gpaw.projects.space.spaceflight

And it has KSP's Music!

Does that mean the music isn't on an exclusive license to ksp? If so where can I download it!

I think it's a mixture of royalty free tracks and their own music. You'll have to search around on the internet for the Royalty free tracks though, unless anyone knows what they're called and where to find them.

The music is indeed royalty-free. It was composed by Kevin MacLeod, who offers a wide selection of such music, including those pieces you can hear in KSP.

http://incompetech.com/music/royalty-free/

As far as I know, the only non-MacLeod pieces in the game are the title screen music, composed by the Harvester himself, and the credits music, though I am not entirely sure about the latter.

The music is indeed royalty-free. It was composed by Kevin MacLeod, who offers a wide selection of such music, including those pieces you can hear in KSP.

http://incompetech.com/music/royalty-free/

As far as I know, the only non-MacLeod pieces in the game are the title screen music, composed by the Harvester himself, and the credits music, though I am not entirely sure about the latter.

Great!, now I can listen to the music while playing without the annoying sound skipping!

Speaking of the music skipping, any official stand on that issue, by Squad? Are they aware of this, and if so, are there any signs it will be completely eliminated in the future? Or is this an issue of "If you have better hardware, that won't happen." thing?

Speaking of the music skipping, any official stand on that issue, by Squad? Are they aware of this, and if so, are there any signs it will be completely eliminated in the future? Or is this an issue of "If you have better hardware, that won't happen." thing?

Old bug with no sign of a fix that I know of... it's actually your whole game skipping, not just the sound although it can be very hard to notice anything other than the sound. A large proportion of KSP players have the same bug - skipping every second... maybe every few seconds so it's widely known about.

May be a unity problem...
Skipping isn't really so bad on my end, but it does get to annoy you, esp. on long interplanetary coasts.
When the music was added to KSP, I immediately recognized the track from this http://scaleofuniverse.com/

In the KSP-files you will see that some music tracks are from Kevin Macloid, I noticed this while playing Dwarf Fortress with the soundsense mod and suddenly hearing a familiar orbital track from KSP. xD

I just found a playlist on youtube that seems to have all the game's tracks, the main artists seem to be Victor Machado and Kevin Macleod, i LOVE the music and hope there will be more in the future, maybe even moon and planet specific like Holst's "the planets," i've said that a few times though, i'm starting to sound like a broken record, it's just that i'd like that so much hehe.

Edited June 16, 2013 by Custard Donut (In Space)
